brief_summary.textblock:
To evaluate the effect of video discharge instructions on return visits to the ER or ED
      within 72 hours of the original visit for children with febrile illnesses.

clinical_study.brief_title: Video Discharge Instructions for Fever and ED Recidivism
clinical_study.condition: Children Who Present to the ED With Minor Febrile Illnesses

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a randomized prospective convenience study of children presenting to the ED.
      Children greater than 8 weeks and up to and including their 18th birthday are enrolled.
      Patients were randomly assigned to one of two study groups: video + written fever specific
      discharge instructions and only written fever specific discharge instructions.  Parents
      assigned to the video group watched the DVD in the emergency department (ED) and take it
      home along with the written instructions.  At 72 hours both groups received a phone call
      asking whether they returned to the ED and the usefulness of discharge instructions (DVD
      and/or written).  Critically ill children and those with chronic medical conditions were
      excluded.   The primary outcome is a return ED visit for fever confirmed in our electronic
      medical record and questionnaire response.  The secondary outcome is reported parental
      usefulness of the discharge instructions.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Children ages 8 weeks to 18 years

          -  Presented to the ED with a chief complaint of fever.  Fever was  defined as a
             temperature greater than or equal to 100.4⁰F

          -  English or Spanish speaking

          -  Working telephone for follow-up call

          -  Venue to view DVD at home (TV, computer, etc)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Children with a chronic medical illness

          -  Children with immune-compromising conditions

          -  Allergies to acetaminophen or ibuprofen

          -  Previously enrolled

          -  Admitted at the time of their index ED visit

clinical_study.official_title: Video Discharge Instructions for Fever and ED Recidivism

primary_outcome.description: Proportion of subjects who returned to the ED within 72 hours of index visit for fever

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Rating of how useful the parents found the discharge instructions

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
